subject: Public Speaking
title: Social Media Rhetoric
description: A short lesson to help you apply Social Media Rhetoric.

hook.text: A tweet is 280 characters. A TikTok is 60 seconds. Modern rhetoric must persuade in micro-doses.

buildup.text: Social media compressed rhetoric into soundbites. The most shared content is emotional, simple, and tribal.

discovery.text: Algorithms amplify outrage and certainty. Nuance and complexity get buried because they don't generate engagement.

twist.text: Ancient rhetoric optimized for live audiences. Modern rhetoric optimizes for algorithms. The audience is now a machine.

climax.text: Platform rhetoric rewards speed over depth. The most persuasive speakers online may not be the most truthful.

punchline.text: The algorithm is the new audience. It doesn't care about truth.

quiz.question: How has social media changed rhetoric?
options: It compressed persuasion into soundbites optimized for algorithms
It eliminated the need for rhetoric
